title: Convenient Econsult Service
body: Used the online consultation for a repeat prescription for a recurring issue. Was quick and efficient and helpful given it’s not easy to get in to see someone face to face. Would have rather face to face, but struggles to make an appointment

title: Excellent service in A&E
body: Visited recently following an accident, the staff were all very polite and helpful. The time taken to be seen was within an hour of arrival which was excellent and with treatment after I left within 2 hours. The staff couldn’t have done anymore to make me feel comfortable and well looked after. A huge thank you to all.

readBy.name: York and Scarborough Teaching Hospital NHS Foundation Trust

title: Well run
body: Attended for a dermatology appointment for my son. Not part of this practice but the doctor was excellent. Sitting in the waiting room I was incredibly impressed by the receptionist. In her own, calm, not flustered, organised, knew where to get information, pass on relevant contact numbers, solve problems all while being kind and courteous. I wish she could train all receptionists everywhere!

title: NHS at its best
body:
I arrived at the surgery at 8.00am and requested an appointment. After a brief conversation with the helpful receptionist I was given an appointment at 8.45. 
I saw a lovely doctor who listened to my worry and gave some practical advice. She advised I had further checks and these were arranged by the receptionist.
Overall a very satisfactory experience.

readBy.name: NHS Bristol, North Somerset and South Gloucestershire CCG

title: Reception staff
body: I’ve been a patient here for years now and as times gone on the reception staff now have attitude and no manners of customer care. Ringing or going in for a appointment and always been told there aren’t any call or come in tomorrow! When we do go in it’s the same the next day and that too to be told with rudeness and attitude.this place has serious staff issues and it’s gone downhill I will be going elsewhere and my family.

title: unprofessional
body: my experience was one of rudeness incompetence  and insensitivity from reception. baffles me in this day and age that the wrong people are still doing the wrong jobs and that apparently untrained or ill trained staff are at the forefont of this inappropriately named service. what happened too manners and people skills.

title: Exceptional service
body: Went over and beyond to accommodate me for my children. Found the GP always goes the extra mile especially one doctor in particular. Thank you all for the peace of mind and help.

title: Helpful staff
body: Really helpful staff. Always smiling happy to help and go the extra mile. GP are wonderful ,always get an appointment and seen on time.

title: Great practice
body: Pleasant environment, very helpful staff. Excellent Doctor. All round fantastic experience. Thank you.

title: Quick and efficient service
body: Was able to make an appointment within a few minutes and visiting the surgery was a very pleasant experience, as all staff were very helpful including the Dr.

title: Great practice
body: Words cant explain the help and support this practice gives to their patients, I have been with this practice since birth. The help and support they provide is excellent. They really go out their way for their patients.

title: Excellent practice
body: Polite friendly staff who go out of their way to accommodate and help patients with their medical needs and sorting last minute prescriptions. If they do not have any appointments left they don’t refuse care and will arrange an out of hours appointment. I see the same doctor every time I have an appointment who again has been excellent and I don’t have to explain my medical needs again from the start. I wish I switched to this practice sooner. I even receive a phone call appointment from my doctor at 7pm and I often see staff cars outside the practice working well into the evening to support the patients’ needs. Anyone who complains about this practice really doesn’t know how bad and understaffed other practices can be! Fantastic place!

title: My surgeon
body: I never usually leave reviews, but with this particular surgeon, I felt compelled to. From the first time I met him, right through the surgery he performed on me to the aftercare, he has been amazing every step of the way. He has been knowledgeable, kind and respectful and I wish I had met him sooner and had the surgery done. It has made such a huge difference. The scar is minimal, the area is smooth and he has done an excellent job and I am thrilled with he work that he did. The hospital itself is lovely, the staff are welcoming, the place is clean and I feel fortunate and lucky. So if anyone has any concerns or worries, I did, then you will be extremely fortunate to have this gentleman as your consultant/surgeon. I just wanted to put that how there, because I know that you only hear negative stuff and reviews often so just feel compelled to write this. I had seen a previous consultant at a different hospital and it had upset me so it took another year before going back to the doctor with the same issue and fortunately this time, I met this surgeon who was kind and patient and took me through each step and the whole experience was so different this time around.

title: Great Practice. Helpful Drs /Staff
body: All the Drs I have seen here have been great. Especially one in particular, she is extremely helpful and such a lovely person. I’m always treated with respect and the reception team are very helpful. All Drs take their time and always want to help. I have never had to wait longer than a few days for an appointment for myself, or a few hours when it’s for my newborn. I’m always seen on time for my appointments. Great practice. Lovely staff

title: outstanding care
body:
My father in law who is an elderly gentleman had surgery for a hernia under the NHS at Spire Liverpool and what fantastic care he received. The nurse looking after him has to be the most caring nurse my father in law and I have met. I have to say despite working in what appeared to be a very busy place, she could not do enough for us, during his stay. All the staff we met where very professional,  although this nurse was so caring in her manner she done everything possible to make sure he was comfortable, and explained everything to us before and after his operation. 
The room he was given was very comfortable and exceptionally clean, his painkillers that he was to go home with was provided by the pharmacist who again explained what he needed to take and when, all before he was due to go home. Fantastic care, well done Spire Liverpool

title: An uncomfortable hospital stay
body:
I am a retired nurse. I understand that we don't make the best patients but I can honestly say that the NHS has changed for the worse. 
I can't understand why nurses and nursing assistants are allowed to wear so much makeup to work. I was in considerable pain one evening and a fresh faced nurse went to get me some medication. I was getting in more discomfort and feeling quite worried as she was taking an awfully long time. She finally returned with a couple of paracetamols (did not touch the pain) in full makeup plastered on including false eyelashes! She must have been doing herself up whilst I was in agony!! The doctor had to be called and I was given morphine. I ended up having a dreadful night.
Other nurses had tattoos all up their arms not covered up. I may sound old fashioned but why is this allowed? It looks dirty to me and some of the tattoos featured nudity. Not a great look on an elderly ward, very offensive. I was not the only patient to feel this way. 
The floors and around the beds were dirty. Why is this? Not acceptable. It would not have happened in my day! 
On the whole I was grateful to the surgeon but the ward was not a very good experience. Maybe Matron should get tough with the nurses.

readBy.name: Western Sussex Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: Outstanding patient care
body: Had an ENT operation at the day surgery unit today. Staff throughout were friendly, compassionate and professional. Every stage was explained to me and any questions answered. Following the surgery and in recovery the staff were so wonderful and caring. The surgeon and anaesthetist both took the time to see me before my discharge to check on me and explain what they had done. This was very much appreciated. The ward, equipment, linen etc were spotless too. Even the coffee was palatable!  Would like to express my sincere thanks to all who made my experience a positive one. NHS at its best, well done everyone.

readBy.name: Blackpool Teaching Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: Find another practice ...
body: Apparently, if you are in urgent need, you will be seen.  If you wish to book an appointment deemed routine by their reception staff, you will have a very long wait.  Most of the reception staff are polite (if somewhat brusque and lacking in empathy) but one, in particular, is downright confrontational.  Whilst waiting to see a GP, I witnessed this person - who was talking so loud the whole waiting room could clearly hear - bully a very vulnerable patient who was concerned and merely trying to get an appointment.  The patient had probably tried 'phoning the practice - a thoroughly miserable experience since you will be kept waiting for an extremely long time.  When you finally get through, you have very little chance of getting an appointment.  You are told that nothing is available and that you need to call back the following morning - between 08.00 and 08.30 to book an appointment weeks in advance.  It may be that other GP surgeries are just as dire but I doubt it.  The doctors are, of course, absolutely fine; the issue is trying to see one.  The bizarre thing is that, despite clearly struggling with existing patient number, this practice is happily taking on new patients.    My advice would be to find another practice.

readBy.name: NHS Bristol, North Somerset and South Gloucestershire CCG

title: Great practice
body:
I have been with this drs surgery for 30 years and am very sorry that I have to leave it as we have recently moved out of the area. If I could keep coming here I would. I have many complex health conditions and have had nothing but understanding and support from every member of staff. I have got to know my own body really well over the years and when I need to see a dr fairly urgently, the majority of the time I have been given a same day appointment. 
We are lucky in that my husband had private healthcare at work and when I’ve asked to be referred to see a consultant privately the referral letter is done either the same day or the next. 
I have had15 plus operations in the last 12 years and have had huge support in helping me to recover when I’ve asked for it. One of the best things about this surgery is that over the years I have got to know the drs & nurse extremely well and feel really comfortable with them and this is very important if you’ve got something to ask that is very private. They are very friendly and put you at ease. The office staff are very helpful too. Once again I’m very sorry to have to leave the support of the drs and staff here, I only hope that my new drs surgery will be like it too.

title: Colman Hospital no treatment its a total disgrace!
body: The situation worsens I've never ever known it to be as bad as this before! I tried to get Physio treatment at the Colman Hospital I got nothing as I'm in agony crawling about and I've now been forced to ask my GP to refare me to the Norfolk and Norwich Hospital for treatment! I Spoke to the N&N they were kind I told them I was in pain could hardly walk crawling around and my mum had died in June 2019 so I had suffered a Bereavement so I was Mourning her they couldn't be kinder! The Colman Hospital however is a disgrace such behaviour towards patients in pain and suffered a Bereavement is totally unacceptable and being forced to go to the Norfolk and Norwich Hospital is down right pathetic as they can help me and are kind while the Colman Hospital is nasty,unhelpful and don't give me the treatment I urgently need so I'll stick with the Norfolk and Norwich Hospital and urge anyone whos had similar problems with the Colman Hospital to go there too you will be glad you did!!

readBy.name: Norfolk Community Health and Care NHS Trust

title: Fracture Clinic and excellent nurse
body:
I would like to leave some excellent feedback for a nurse in the fracture clinic at QMC. On my few visits she has been truly amazing and she is an asset to your ward. She made me feel like I’m being looked after with care, gives great advice on my fractured ankle and gave me dressings for me wound on my ankle.
She is a nurse who goes above and beyond for making sure patients like me are looked after and made to feel at ease. Also a great benchmark in what good nursing looks like. 
So thank you for looking after me during a stressful time for myself with my fractured ankle. 
Also thank you to all the other staff in the fracture clinic who have been excellent.

title: Great empathy
body:
Would just like to take the opportunity to thank the staff who cared for my sister who passed away in their care, you could really see it wasn’t just a job to them. She was given dignity and we were given guidance and encouragement to say our good byes.
We were talked through what we would see in the room when we walked in and we had several members of staff check in on us as a family. The team is a credit to the NHS and we thank you sincerely for your kind caring empathy towards us.

title: 7hrs in A&E
body:
I attended the A&E with some haste following symptoms that could signal heart attack or stroke.
I was seen by a doctor approx four hours after I arrived.
I had an EMG and blood test and left approx seven hours after I arrived.
The waiting area, toilets and cubicles were filthy. Staff I saw did not use gloves and patients were crammed into two mini waiting areas. Some of the patients were coughing, vomiting and another sat in his own filth. The stench was overwhelming yet he was wheeled in and sat near the waiting crowd. In the seven hours I was there I did not see a cleaner. Cubicles were not cleaned after patients so I cleaned the cubicle I was in with antiseptics wipes. 
The doctor was polite and helpful. The majority of the nursing staff demonstrated a marked lack of empathy while I witnessed a doctor behaving callously.
The outstanding disgrace was the hygiene. Never in my life have I seen anything like this in a hospital. 
I will not attend this hospital again, even in the worst emergency.

title: Very impressed
body: I have not needed to go to my gp for a few years and needed to go twice this month with my children. Each time we quickly received an appointment either on the day or the next day, all the staff were very polite and helpful. The doctors were very knowledgeable, supportive and helpful.

title: very poor
body: I've been trying to book an appointment on the same day for the last three days. Firstly, they never picked up the phones at 8 a.m. Once they answered (after 11) I was told that not time slot was left for the day. I was suggested to book online, but however early I tried (4 a.m.!) still, no time slot was available with any doctor, any time of the day! I believe they just cancelled the same day service. Awful experience!

title: Excellent care
body:
I have just spent some time in the Urology department having a Dynamics test carried out by two nursing sisters. They were lovely !! Totally professional in their approach but very friendly with an empathetic  manner. They explained what was happening and went over the results afterwards.
I know I will be back in the department again soon but have no doubts that from reception to treatment and afterwards the response will be the same.
This is an excellent faculty of the hospital.

title: Great Doctor
body: Based on this recent visit alone, I would recommend this practice. I saw a young doctor who gave me all the time I needed to explain my issue and he took the time the explain a lot to me, showing pictures on the computer etc to explain more. You don’t often have the time there and feel rushed but he was brilliant. I also managed to get an appointment the day after I asked for one which is very unusual.

title: Excellent treatment
body:
I had three eye operations over a period of three months for a detached retina.
I found all the staff and Doctors to be extremely professional patient and kind despite being very over worked.
I would also like to thank the Consultant for saving my sight.

readBy.name: Torbay and South Devon NHS Foundation Trust

title: Nigh on impossible to get an appointment
body: While I have put the date as now, we have experienced difficulties over a number of years with regard to booking an appointment to see a doctor. You can't book them in advance, for some reason, and therefore have to call at 8am on the day, only to be told there are none available. Who are the patients getting these appointments?

title: Very poor
body: I rang from 8:00 when they open and didnt get through till 8:15 to then be told within 15 minutes the whole day was fully booked. How am i meant to see a doctor when appointments are near impossible to get. This place is very poor in my opinion. I understand doctors are very busy but if all appointments are gone within 15 minutes with no chance of getting through to them, prehaps this doctors has to many patients.

title: Excellent
body: After years of being told my condition was 'just one of those things,' a new GP referred me to a Consultant who immediately put me on the correct medication. The service here is great. I felt like I was being listened to and finally helped. Thank you.

title: Shocking service and communication
body: Request a prescription and I’m waiting days for it then to be told it got refused without being informed. Then I need to see a doctor and there are no appointments for 3 weeks minimum . Then I was told I was being sent to another practise because they can’t accommodate any appointments. Shocking service.

title: Great Doctors & Staff
body:
I am extremely pleased with the service provided by the Practice. All the doctors I have seen are very pleasant and explain very clearly the condition/problem you have and the treatment. I feel that I can talk to them and are very understanding and reassure me and my family with their experience and havefull confidence in them
Likewise all the support staff, reception, nurses  and secretarial staff are very helpful and are always eager to help

title: Ultrasound
body: Very good experience informed of everything that was happening eased any fears I may have had very reassuring person doing the procedure

title: rude reception lady
body:
I have spoken to the same person twice now with a rude and inappropriate manner.  I cannot name them due to nhs review rules but I will raise this with the surgery manager.
Although judging by no responses ever on there views on here, does not look like the manager cares much either!?
All very pleasant until you ask as question that cannot be answered and then the tactic is to be obstructive and curt so you do not feel comfortable talking any longer to her, disgusting attitude!
One time when I announced the name of who I was calling about she actually said "what's wrong today?" (through an audible sigh!), unnecessarily sarcastic and unsympathetic behaviour.

title: Honestly a bunch of angels
body:
Thank you all for your continued support
Glad you get to be part of my recovery journey
The doctors, nurses, receptionists, and everyone else are so lovely. Couldn’t be in better hands
Thanks for your patience and support

readBy.name: Coventry and Warwickshire Partnership NHS Trust

title: Confident practice
body: I found this practice to be so relaxing staff was excellent and made you feel comfortable everything was explained to me before my scan and after very reassuring I would recommend

title: Poor Practice
body:
One of the worst surgeries to answer the phone if not the worst!
Kept me holding on for 40 minutes and then put the phone down and this wasn't the first time it's happened. Tried ringing back engaged all the time. I've been with this practice for many years only beacuse of one doctor who is exceptional. 
The reception area is never busy with that many phone calls or attending to patients so god only knows why they keep the phone on engage or keep you waiting??
The message on the phone is ridiculous always stating you are either 1st or 2nd in the que and waiting time from 2 minutes moves to 40-60 minutes?/
Management really need to sort this out ASAP!!!

title: Positive experience
body: I was a little nervous attending my appointment. However, I was called promptly for my appointment. Everything was explained clearly and my questions were answered in full. The procedure was fast and the surgeon spoke to me throughout putting me at ease. I would recommend the dermatology clinic to anyone who needs minor surgery.

title: Empathic and understanding
body: My doctor has been wonderful. Empathic and understanding and really listens. She has been so helpful and really knows what’s she’s talking about and great at helping facilitate care. A really lovely human being.

title: Great Practice
body: I would like to say that my doctor has been fantastic. She has got great people skills. When discussing my health problems with this doctor, they are carefully listening and takes the best course of action that is required. A great Dr overall, really impressed.

title: A service to be proud of A********
body: Had a problem with my right eye at work, cut a long story short was seeing lines across my eye, phoned the eye emergency department, they saw me the following morning and was seen straight away and treated. From the nursing staff right the way up to the consultant who checked me over I cannot speak more highly of them. Thank you your all gems and don't get enough positive feedback

title: Terrible service
body:
Was booked for an appointment, took time off work only to find out that there was no record of the appointment.
Was passed to numerous different people one after the other, none of which really wanted to help and just wanted to pass the problem on to someone else. 
Mistakes can happen and that's fine but it would have been nice for one individual to take ownership and try and help.

readBy.name: St Helens and Knowsley Hospitals NHS Trust

author: Lawson Patient
title: A good level of customer service
body: While waiting at the GP’s seating area, I noticed Davinnia was on the phone handling a difficult conversation; saying that, I can’t praise enough of Davinnia’s patience at talking to the patient on the other end over some difficult request, she was constructive to calm the patient down on the call, polite and professional in her replies, all in all she had provided a good level of customer service. Nice to see her around the GP.

title: Lovely staff but lots of mix ups
body: The staff here are always so helpful  and friendly but today marks the 5th visit for the same test (booked with wrong person, given wrong date, lab lost results, etc.). I have also been waiting just over a month for ultrasound results. Always appreciate the NHS though and am lucky to have free healthcare at all!

title: Awful waiting times
body: I was given an appointment for 9:10 I checked in and it had changed to 9:36 without them telling me and I waited for an hour and a half to be seen. I have 2 children under 2 with me and I booked in for an emergency with severe side pains by the time I reached the doctors I could barely move

title: Simply the breast!
body:
I would like to say a huge thank you to all the staff, from the receptionists through to the consultant at gate 22, and to all staff in breast surgery at gate 40. You are all amazing! 
I had my op for breast cancer yesterday after seeing my G.P seven weeks ago and I cannot praise the system, efficiency, and care from staff enough.  I have felt totally cared for, every question I have asked has been answered in an reassuring  and honest way and I have never felt other than being important. 
Each and every one of you deserve a big hug!  Thank you all for making what has been a traumatic few weeks into a positive and uplifting experience. My treatment isn’t finished yet but I know that I am in safe and caring hands. Thank you all again.

title: Unprofessional receptionist
body:
My son is currently experiencing severe migraines every 2 days for the past week. We contacted the surgery yesterday but was offered an appointment for the 12th March. I explained that he could not wait this long and that he was suffering from severe sickness, incapacitating head pains and vision loss. This was affecting his schooling and everyday life. She was extremely rude and unsympathetic, replying well I can give you a telephone call back on 5th March!!! It seems this is not an emergency , I demanded that a doctor calls me back otherwise I would have to call 111. Eventually she put us on the call back list. However no call back received,I today called back and yet again the rude receptionist looked into the matter, saying that the doctor called
back, I have no record on my phone, nor any messages to say they had called. She became very rude saying look I’ve spoken to you several time’s and it had been done. I now await another call back!!

title: Unprofessional and incompetent
body: Been trying to get an appointment for over six months at this practice for a serious ongoing medical condition, ring every morning at 8am to be put in a long queue then to be told no appointments left. Complained to manager over two weeks ago and still haven't heard anything back. Receptionists very rude and patronising, rang today for an appointment to be told no more appointments but still taking on new patients from the area when they can't deal with the ones they already have on the books. Absolutely disgusting, and now the next step will be to speak to the obudsman as this is ridiculous. If you can't offer appointments to the patients you already have, don't take on more!

author: Jff
title: Treatment not yet available
body: I believe Erenumab was approved by the Scottish Medicines Consortium in April 2019 for the treatment of migraine, yet almost a year later I understand this treatment is still not available. I want to know when will it be available to me from the Queen Elizabeth University Hospital in Glasgow?

title: Amazing care
body: From initial visit to consultant through to day surgery was excellent. Consultant was informative and showed great empathy. Day surgery went very smoothly. All staff where very attentive informative and caring. Couldn’t have received better care.

title: Terrible!
body:
This was everything bad about the NHS.
Patients were packed into a tiny corridor rather than a proper waiting room.
There were hardly any chairs. Most people were standing up along the walls or sitting on the floors.
The staff may blame central government, but they themselves made no effort to find additional chairs so that people could at least be comfortable while waiting. A person asking for a chair was accused by staff of asking for VIP treatment. He was wearing a suit and I think the member of staff made some kind of presumption, but the man's request was perfectly reasonable.
There was nowhere to get water, everyone was parched.
There was nowhere to get any food.
There was nothing to read or anything to distract yourself with.
The waits were long, 3 hours or longer.
There was no privacy, people were laid out in the beds being looked at by medics with the curtains wide open.
The staff were rude, brusque and callous to everyone.
Not all of the problems described here were down to NHS finance. They were down to callous decisions made by NHS staff and their  managers.

author: J Bloggs
title: Highland Infant Feeding Support (Dingwall)
body:
The infant feeding support system in provided in the Highlands has been brilliant. Prior to birth I was offered an online course (via facebook), a group 'parentcraft' session, and a 1-to-1 session with my infant feeding support worker Daione. I did all three and felt prepared for breastfeeding.  
After birth Daione offered home visits, which I was lucky enough not to require. The weekly drop-in sessions she runs have been invaluable - the perfect set-up for new mums. A relaxed environment and fellow mums and healthcare professionals to answer questions on any worries, not only breastfeeding. I attend weekly even if I have no issues myself. No other baby groups offer such a welcoming place for mums with babies as young as a few days around other mums who know exactly what you are going through. As well as ensuring I have a well fed baby the group also greatly helps my mental wellbeing.  
On top of breastfeeding support Daione also arranges other ventures to drop-in to the sessions - such as baby sling demos, play support workers, and baby sensory tasters. These are all really useful too!  
I am also lucky that living midway between two feed support groups on weeks when the DIngwall group cannot run I am made to feel really welcome at the Alness group run by Lana.

author: SH987
title: My son hurt his finger
body:
I would appreciate if someone could pass on a huge thank you to Carol in minor injuries.  
My son hurt his finger at school today and Carol was amazing. It was only a minor injury but was very painful and Carol really put my son, at ease.  
Nursing is not only about treating an injury but, I think just as important is a bedside manner especially with a young child. We were not in for long but Carol was great at distracting my son by asking him about his hobbies and his home life. I am sure if Carol was not distracting him he would have been very upset. She did an awesome job and I just wanted to say thanks, she is a credit to the NHS

readBy.name: Office of Ken Macintosh, MSP for West of Scotland
East Renfrewshire Health & Social Care Partnership

title: Good continuity of care
body:
I was under the care of Oban maternity unit for both my pregnancies, and had a very positive experience each time.  
I found the continuity of care to be very good and was able to have Elayne as my midwife for both pregnancies. All the staff I came across in the unit, midwives, admin and domestic were friendly and professional. I felt able to get in touch at any time with concerns and was well supported post natal.  
Also, Having the scanning service locally made such a difference second time round, as with my first in 2017 we had to travel to the VOL and my morning sickness made the journey quite unpleasant.  
We are very lucky to have this service.

readBy.name: Office of Rhoda Grant, MSP for Highlands and Islands

author: JOL
title: Infant feeding support worker
body:
I had help from Daoine, an Infant feeding support worker in the Highlands, when my son was born to help establish breastfeeding. After 2 weeks of trying myself and lots of tears, I was experiencing a lot of pain and developed mastitis. Daoine came round to my house with a midwife to help look at positioning during breastfeeding and check for tongue tie. Tongue tie was quickly spotted and I got an appointment at a clinic to sort it out.  
I have been attending Daoine's feeding support group in Dingwall since. This has helped me get out the house and meet other people in a relaxed environment. I wasn't feeling confident about going to other groups in the early month due to not being comfortable with breastfeeding yet. However, this group was so welcoming. Without the help from the infant feeding support worker and group I would probably not still be breastfeeding.

author: Wulliemack 2
title: My son would like to say thank you to everyone
body:
I would like to say a Big Big thank you to professor McKay and the team of pancriatic specialists in Glasgow Royal infirmary for looking after and taking care of my son.  
He was transferred from Wishaw general hospital A C C U unit in January 2020 to intensive care unit west, Glasgow Royal Queen Elizabeth, thank you to Mr downie and his team at Wishaw general for taking care of him while he was in ward 16 and 18 and when he was in induced coma for 9 days then he was transferred to Glasgow Royal.  
He is still in the high dependency Glasgow Royal, he has been through so much but it can only get better, the plan today was to flush out and see what was going on, instead they removed the stent and replaced it with a new long term one, and he still has to drains in his lower tummy, and the food tube is still in place the plan is to ween him of the food tube as he is now on solid food.  
He didn't realise he'd been in hospital 6 weeks, he has been told he will be going back to Wishaw general as soon as there is a bed, a Big thank you from me and my son

author: Advocate1
title: IMHA - you were very helpful
body:
'Thank you for helping me - you were very helpful. You helped me to get clippers and things to shave with. It is good that people can get support when they are ill'.  
(Interpreted from client's comments to advocate in Arabic during the final client meeting in February 2020)

author: uhh202
title: All staff are smiling
body:
Ward 5. Nurses are amazing. They care for you as an individual and make you feel cosy. Medication arrives when it should. Nurses will stop and pass time of day. If nurse busy when patient requests help, they will say they will return in a few minutes.... and they do. Support staff all very good, they always have time to stop and pass the time of day. All staff are smiling (which patient much appreciated) although everyone is busy with their job.  
One doctor spent time explaining to patient condition. Another doctor today did not spend time communicating with patient who was left with any unasked and therefore unanswered questions. MRI scan had been done and results available.  
Patient been informed to ask for extra medication if required, and has done. This was provided quickly by nursing staff.

title: Decent practice
body: It is never busy when I go. Staff act professional. I arrived early for my appointment so they were able to accommodate me earlier than my appointment time which was great. The assistant explained most of the procedure to me. But I was supposed to be seeing someone else, so I could tell there must have been a shortage of staff.

title: The staff are amazing!
body:
The staff at ENT and on S12 are amazing, absolutely fantastic.  You feel really safe in their hands. 
The admin side of appointments / clinic / surgery is super stressful and Bookings and department dont seem to speak to each other....but the staff themselves from the secretary's to the nurses are all superb.

readBy.name: Doncaster and Bassetlaw Teaching Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: Great practice and very good service
body: Very clean and nice building, polite , well organised and professional staff. I hadn't to wait even one minute and the doctor and the nurse were very kind

author: Danmz93
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: I come out of groups feeling better
body: One Recovery has been amazing for me. A very supportive and understanding service. I come out of groups feeling better, get support from the service users and my keyworker is great.

title: Phone call for appointment
body: I have been on the phone for 45mins I rang at 8.30 to book to see a Doctor. By the time I got through all appointments had gone. I was number 49 in the que . I have been with this surgery for 28yrs. Never have I had to wait that long. This not the first time. It’s every time you ring the waiting is disgusting. You say you are going to look into the problem . Since March 2019??? Once I was on the phone waiting to get through while I waited for an answer I drove from my house to the surgery and stood in a small que with me still being on hold on my phone. No one was answering the phones behind the desk You have over a 1000.00 patients and still taking on more when you can’t cope with what you already have.You need more phone lines ?. And more doctors that are going stop there not different ones each time.Its very difficult to get to see the same doctor that knows you and your illness.

author: TicToc Granny
title: Breast Clinic
body:
In 2019 I was referred to the breast clinic at Borders General Hospital. Naturally this caused some anxiety for me.  
When I attended the clinic, all the staff made me feel cared for and as reassured as you can be when facing tests for breast cancer. I was lucky, and everything came back clear, but I felt I would be supported whatever the outcome. I just wanted to say thank you.

author: Danmz93
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: I found it really helped
body: I am really happy with the keyworkers I have had. I have been coming for some time. I have attended SRP in the past and found it really helped. Women's Group is great to discuss / rant over things with like minded people.

author: foxtrotsf59
title: The approach seems very attractive and user friendly
body: Have been around the block as service user many times.   Have always found case workers sympathetic and helpful if a little overworked and under-resourced.   The 'inclusion' approach seems very attractive and user friendly because so much is peer led.   I look forward to building my effective recovery and even giving something back.

author: Danmz93
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Overwhelmed by how much support is on offer!
body: I have only just started my journey with ORB, and I am completely over-whelmed by how much support that is on offer! I am feeling confident, in where I am and where I am going!

title: Appalling practice
body: I had a home visit on two occasions. On the first I was prescribed Quietapine and just left to get on with it with absolutely no follow up. An horrible drug on which I didn't know where i was or what I was doing, so  stopped taking it. On the second visit I was prescribed Mirtazapine, again no follow up, just left to get on with it. No concern for my mental health or the side effects of either of these drugs on me. Whilst I appreciate funding is cut, I don't think that can be used as an excuse for the total lack of duty of care from this place. While they may listen, they don't actually "hear" you and just give you a prescription and walk away. The person running the show should be hanging their head in shame. Just because I am an NHS patient does this mean I deserve substandard treatment? I or anybody else would and have been severely let down by these people time and again. Their attitude truly stinks. They lack empathy and care....To be honest I wouldn't bother with them if you don't have to. They leave you feeling worse, not better. A total fail as a mental health service in my view

title: Absolutely rubbish
body: I think it’s very inappropriate that nurses are discussing a child in a public place in full hearing of other patients and their families. What has happened to patient confidentiality has certainly been breached on this certain ward

readBy.name: St Helens and Knowsley Hospitals NHS Trust

author: pavobx74
title: Always made welcome
body:
Regular attendance of 'work' sessions prove their effectiveness for myself and others.  
Good to share stories - always received in friendship and fellowship.  
Always made welcome as a 'centre user' or new entrant.  
Sometimes the room can be a bit clammy or 'close' if people need their own space.  
More usable copies of the Alcoholics Anonymous bible needed for the R>I>T>S> meetings, perhaps people could have to sign a copy for the day - within the room only.

title: Fantastic caring staff
body: Cannot praise this medical centre enough . Seen promptly, x rayed and plaster within an hour . Everyone we spoke to was caring and professional . We are not from the area but everything was forwarded to our local hospital .

author: matargg95
title: Very thankful
body: My experience with Inclusion has been really helpful.   Ready to change my life and inclusion is helping lovely to get there.   Very thankful

title: Fantastic service
body: Great service , amazing receptionists always helpful and polite. Always get seen , nothing to much trouble . The doctor is outstanding , patient , extremely helpful and puts you at ease and me personally would like to say a massive thankyou for his fast acting and getting me seen and sorted fast to something that could of turned out so different . For me thankyou isnt enough.  Great doctors .

title: Great practice
body:
Appointment on time.reception staff brilliant.
Procedure done excellent.bye dr and nurse.
Waiting room very relaxed and pleasant
Every thing explained well.would recommend
To anyone.

title: Excellent review
body: Recently had my yearly Asthma review with the practice nurse who was both caring and understanding in her approach , during the consultation the nurse picked up on a chest infection and immediately got me an appointment with a GP that same day within 2 hours.  I can’t tell you how reassuring quality treatment puts me at ease, well done and thank you to my Asthma nurse and GP.  110 percent effort

title: Kind considerate caring practice
body:
The care which I recieve to day was extremely proffessional considerate, caring we need more Doctors and staff like this.
You talk to people and they try there best to help you

But please try and find out where to send my sons to resolve his ingrowing finger nail its extrememly painfull. Its not nice seeing a beautiful caring loving son, coming home from school in tears due to his foot and finger pain

title: Too busy
body: Being a life long patient of this practice I can only say that I feel it is now too big in order to deal with the patients efficiently. I believe there are over 14,000 patients between 7 - 8 Doctors. You cannot see your regular doctor unless you wait up to 2 weeks in advance and they wont book that far ahead. So basically book your illness in advance. Getting repeat prescriptions is a joke as you run out before they are authorised and specialist attention with the likes of diabetes is non existent. The phone staff are rude and really do not have any interest. When I threatened to make a complaint their response was "do it" I did. The response from the practice manager was 8 weeks later and could not do anything because they did not know who was working on that day. This is a typical example of an over worked practice which appears to be working for profits over patient care. I feel for the doctors but their "duty of care" for patients has to come before making money for the surgery by swamping it with patients who cannot get an appointment! What is the point of having patients who cannot get appointments. Not everyone s computer literate to do things online.

author: Uhh201
title: Patient happy with care provided
body:
Ward 9.  
Patient happy with care provided by Occupational Therapist who has been very helpful. Helped with diet, and has organised. and given appliances to use at home. Nurses have been very good,  
Buzzers sometimes go for a while and other times not, usually longer at night.  
Medication arrives at varying times.  
Doctors have explained condition for patient in language he understands. Patient been kept informed of road ahead and has been given an date to go home.  
Family have been able to access meetings with nurses/doctors at times suitable to family. Family happy with this.

readBy.name: South Lanarkshire Health and Social Care Forum

author: composerxt77
title: Coming here gives me something to get up for
body: My experience of Inclusion has been nothing but positive.   I have been through an extremely difficult time and the staff, volunteers and other service users have been really supportive throughout and I have found their advice really helpful and has helped me put my life back on track and improved my way of life greatly.   Coming here gives me something to get up for, and I enjoy it so much, everyone is so friendly and welcoming, making what can and has been an awful time so much easier.   Keep up the great work guys!

author: eateryj65
title: RITS - I put my trust in Inclusion
body:
When I was a broken man, I put my trust in with the service and so glad that I did.  
My life has turned around for the better.

title: Top practice
body: Always able to find a suitable appointment. (Must call at 8am)The GPS are nice and you don’t feel rushed. The have early/late appointments on some days so you don’t have to take time off work. Also, very good at proactively contacting me for checkups etc...

author: KimberlyG
title: Mum's care
body:
I would like to thank the  
H@H  
team in Coatbridge for the level of care from the team which exceeded mine and my mums expectations. The care and attention can only be described as excellent. Not only did this prevent my mum having to go into hospital on two occasions but the communication, advice and support from the team not only helped my mum but gave me the confidence that I was treating her to the best of my ability.  
Thank you, Grateful Daughter

readBy.name: North Lanarkshire Health & Social Care Partnership

author: jivemk76
title: She checked on em a lot to see if I was ok
body: Louise was very helpful and checked on me a lot to see if I was ok.   She is easy to talk to and is good at listening.

title: Appointment system
body: On 14th February after receiving a phone call from a nurse to say i need to see a doctor urgently i asked her if she could make the appointment for me, she said she could not. Next day at 8am I rang to get an appointment and was eventually told I had to fill in an econsult. I filled the form in but it did not contain a box to tick appertaining to why I needed an appointment, so i ticked something else and a message popped up to say someone would contact me before 6pm on Monday. someone did contact me very quickly. On Monday 17th I received a letter from the surgery saying from 24th February patients have to use econsult form online. Why was i not able to make an appointment via telephone on 14th February. What would happen in you are at work or on public transport when the ring back service ring you and you cannot pick up. What about the elderly and frail who may not have access to the internet. The cost of ringing the surgery plus the time people who have no internet have to pay for an appointment is unacceptable. My husband has wrote to the practice manager but has yet not received a reply. I have wrote to our M.P. and would urge any patient who is not satisfied to do the same.

title: Good Modern Practice
body:
No nonsense, no fuss.
New iconsultation works very very well
Saves phone call waiting for an appointment and gets the job done quickly and efficiently where possible ( eg my recent sick note experience )

title: Very member of staff re stars
body:
From arriving at  A&E, onto resus unit and then on to CCU my care and how I was treated could not have been better.

Every department and me ever of staff I have mentioned should be congratulated in their level of care.
Every single member of staff were complete stars from reception, nurses to doctors.

I would place my life in their hands which I pretty much will be doing in a months time

Well done burton, and well done the NHS

Proud

author: TaylorB
title: Endocrinology Appointment
body:
My daughter was given an outpatient appointment with the Endocrinology Department, within the Children's Hospital at the Queen Elizabeth University Hospital for the beginning of February 2020.  
The date of the appointment clashed with a weekend away our family had planned, so I contacted the central booking office to ask if this could be re-scheduled. The central booking office cancelled the appointment, but told us they could not re-book and that the Endocrinology department would be informed and re-book for us asap.  
2 weeks had passed and I had received no new appointment for my daughter. I called the central booking office, they could give me no information. I called Endocrinology secretary directly, and got an answer phone. I left a message on the voicemail with my daughters CHI number, my name and number and requested a call back.  
I got no response, so one week later I called the Endocrinology department again. The phone was answered by a member of the admin staff who took my daughters name and acknowledged we had called the week before, but they personally hadn't been here and noone is checking the phones.  
This admin staff member told me my daughters appointment would be re-scheduled. They could not tell me how much longer we would have to wait or when the new appointment would be.  
This staff member also inferred on the phone that we had simply not turned up for the appointment, which was most worrying. I cancelled 3 weeks in advance, as I am well aware of the pressure on the services, and issues with DNAs.  
I asked for a call back and was told they would speak to the relevant Consultant and get back to me that day or the next. It is several days down the line and I have had no response.  
Due to a simple clash with our weekend away and the appointment, we have now waited an additional 3 weeks on top of the 10 weeks we waited for the appointment in the first place.  
I am becoming more concerned by my 5 year old daughters presentation, the details of which I won't go into here. This is causing anxiety for myself and my husband.  
The communication here has been very poor, and I am extremely disappointed at the lengths I have had to go to wait in telephone queues, leave voicemails, be told I was getting contacted and have a return of absolutely nothing. I do wonder how those less able than myself cope in these situations.  
For this reason I thought best to put this through Care Opinion in the hope it doesn't happen to someone else, with a health concern about a small child.  
In the meantime I will need to keep plugging away to get a response. Not ideal with a busy job and life.

readBy.name: Office of Clare Haughey, MSP for Rutherglen

title: Disappointing
body:
I managed to eventually make an appointment for which I had to wait 3 weeks - fine as it wasn't too urgent; just a great deal of discomfort from something I had experienced before.  The doctor diagnosed exactly what i thought it was and said to come back if it continued.  I have tried twice now to make an alternative appointment the first time the very unhelpful receptionist said go to the Pharmacist - I did, he said see the doctor.    Have tried again and unfortunately got someone on the phone that was even more unhelpful and still can't get an appointment, I have to ring back on Monday which is currently 4 days away.  So instead i am going to go and waste the time at A&E.

I have always found this practice difficult but they are getting worse the time has come to change doctors - do avoid if you want an appointment in this lifetime.

title: Repeat prescriptions
body: I work in Sheffield and my Doctors surgery is in Bentley i start work at 06.30am and don't finish until 5pm so as you can tell I cannot get to the surgery to order repeat prescriptions yet the practice will not accept repeat prescriptions over the phone so I cannot get my medication I feel this is a definite step backwards so I am seriously  considering changing my doctors to one that is more up to date with the requirements of its patients

author: Uhh203
title: Nurses ensure that patients are given time
body:
Ward 9  
Nursing staff have been brilliant. Make you feel relaxed about procedures and comfortable that you are not being a bother or the only one this has happened to. Nurses ensure patient given time to move and explained there is no rush. Patient would love to see nurses get paid more for all the work they do. Much appreciated.  
Doctors explained condition to patient in language she understood. Patient given opportunity to discuss condition with doctors.  
Mediation arrives on time. Patient just need to ask for more mediation if required and this is provided quickly.  
Family happy with care received. Family easily access time with nurses to discus patient.

readBy.name: South Lanarkshire Health and Social Care Forum

author: Nhynes13
title: Phlebotomy
body:
I was advised by my doctor at Coatbank Medical Practice today that I would need blood taken. I am highly nervous about anything to do with blood or needles so I was extremely anxious and panicky.  
Kim, who took my blood was an absolute credit to the service and put me completely at ease. She reassured me throughout the process and made it a totally painless procedure. I can’t thank her enough and if I need to get blood taken again I would ask for her specifically as it would help me with my anxiety around the process. Thank you so much!

author: Thankful gran
title: Couldn't have been more impressed with the service
body:
Attended University Hospital Monklands this afternoon with my granddaughter who was injured at school.  
Was so impressed with the service. It is a minor injuries unit and A and E. We were seen within 45 minutes of arriving and my granddaughter was given pain killers , x ray and discharged with instructions on care all within 2 hours .  
Seen by Staff Nurse Gaynor who took the time to explain things to my granddaughter about her foot injury and explained step by step what was happening and took the time to explain the reason for the post injury care . Couldnt have been more impressed with the service we received during what was obvious to see was a very busy time .  
Thank you , monklands A and E

title: No care and receptionist staff rude
body: I was trying to book appoitment for few days when each time GP online service refused to give me one I have decided to contact 111 and spoke 2 times to then and both times they have advised me to call go as I need to be seen with in 24 hours.Alsi they have sent note to GP to let them know what they have advised me .I ended up in A&E on the fourth day coughing with blood.How the hell reception staff can override 111 staff and clinician advice and ignore the fact  I was getting worse every single day.NHS should look closer to issue in this surgery as I belive is more people who had similar.I work and pay to recive health care if I need to.

title: Staff no good
body: Tride to rebook appointment and just got no help at all but attude so I've give up on this and will have to wait 2 year to see if I can sort it then at my review

author: J - a grateful daughter
title: Old Hastings House
body: My mother has been a resident at Old Hastings House for almost five years, and it is hard to fault the care provided. I live 700 miles away, and I know I can totally trust the staff. They keep me informed, are always friendly and welcoming when I visit. Above all, my mother feels safe, she loves the staff (many of whom have worked here for years), the food and the personal touches. I know that I can trust this care home to provide the care that my mother needs and to take into account her wishes.

title: grotty and uncared for
body: Filthy windows, graffiti that's not cleaned off, doors that need painting, patients with dementia left to rot in bed.  Avoid if at all possible.

readBy.name: London North West University Healthcare NHS Trust

author: Jten2716
title: Good communication skills would have gone a long way
body:
Working in the NHS myself, I was reluctant to comment on my experience in Ward 19/20 as I understand the pressures staff are working under however I had a very mixed experience.  
My 2 year old daughter was to Ward 19 by my gp at 10.30 with concerns that she was vomiting and refusing oral fluid intake. I was told that she did not need to be assessed at that time but was given open access to the Ward if she did not improve. I was happy with this and when I phoned the Ward, they were helpful and there was no issue arranging an assessment.  
On arrival, the Ward was busy, but we were shown to a waiting room and triaged promptly, where my daughter was found to have a blood sugar of 1.7. This was treated promptly by nursing staff with good communication of what was happening and my daughter was quickly taken to a treatment room to have blood taken and a venflon inserted. My daughter was then put in a bed.  
I was told my father and 10 month old baby could not stay as this would mean there was 3 visitors around the bed and the Ward policy is 2. I feel that some discretion could have been used here but it was a minor issue. I was asked to take a urine sample from her and give her a glucose drink. My daughter was lethargic and was refusing oral intake as she vomited every time she tried to take fluid, as she did during her triage, and therefore despite me trying, she refused the glucose drink. I informed nursing staff of this promptly.  
The next time we saw nursing staff was for a set of observations, when I asked when a decision would be made regarding admission as I am a single mum with a 10 month old who I would need to arrange childcare for and it was now evening. I was told medical staff would come and assess my daughter. She fell asleep 10 minutes before being reviewed by medical staff. I did not feel it was appropriate to keep waking her as I had done as she continued to refuse fluids and I had informed staff and was distressed ++ when woken.  
The member of medical staff did not introduce themselves to me. The opening sentence was that a decision could not be made on whether my daughter would be admitted or not if I don’t try and give her fluids and that this staff member had been busy dealing with an emergency. I would like to clarify that I never commented on how long it took my daughter to be reviewed by medical staff and that I only asked when a decision would be made to allow my 10 month old daughter to be taken home if my 2 year old was being admitted as it was 8pm at night, no childcare arrangements had been made and we live a 30 minute drive from the hospital.  
When I tried to explain that my daughter was referred as she was refusing fluids due to associating this with vomiting as she had been unable to keep fluids down up to this point and that I can’t force her to drink when she does not wish to, I was told I was “confrontational”. I was upset by this as I am a medical professional myself and did not raise my voice or use abusive language. I had also spent by this time the best part of 24 hours trying to get my daughter to drink and failing and I felt it was implied I wasn’t trying hard enough.  
This medical staff member then proceeded to try and take an extremely brief history, which I feel may have been helpful initially to understand why my daughter was there however any rapport was lost by this stage. Examination was through and I was told my daughter would be admitted for Iv fluids and to no longer try to give her oral fluids and allow her to rest, contradictory to what I had been told by the same member of staff 10 minutes previously.  
She was transferred to Ward 20 and I cannot speak more highly of the night shift staff who took care of my daughter. I was allowed to settle my daughter in the way I felt appropriate, was shown around the Ward and my daughter was checked on frequently and appropriately. Communication was excellent and I was aware of what was going to happen and when. There was toys available on the Ward which helps keep the children entertained, particularly if they can’t leave the bed.  
My only other issues with Ward 20 is that adult cutlery is supplied with meals. My 2 year old couldn’t fit the spoon in her mouth making it difficult for her to eat the soup so more age appropriate cutlery would be a good idea. My daughter also had a cows milk allergy and I had to provide my own food as there was no appropriate alternatives on the ward, however I appreciate this was mainly due to time constraints. There did appear to be a lack of communication among staff about dietary allergies as my daughter was given food with milk in it and although meant kindly, the member of staff did not appear to realise my daughter’s allergy. In this case, not a huge problem however in more serious allergies, this lack of communication could have had serious consequences.  
I appreciate staff are extremely busy and are working very hard however no parent wants their child admitted to hospital and good communication skills, particularly from medical staff more than nursing staff in this case, would have gone a long way to making this a better patient journey.

readBy.name: North Lanarkshire Health & Social Care Partnership

author: J and J
title: The Amazing ....Ward 4C Haematology
body:
When my partner was diagnosed with leukaemia and admitted to the Queen Elizabeth University Hospital , Ward 4C we instantly knew that this ward was special and very different to anything we’d seen before.  
We arrived on the ward in shock and just broken with the news having just came through a tough year with him battling throat cancer . The staff on the ward literally held us together as the news sunk in and continued to do so every day for the next 5 months as he faced an endless amount of challenges.  
Every single member of staff on the ward has played a part in getting us through a very difficult time. They cared not only for my partner but gave me the much emotional support I needed at the time , something I’ll never forget.  
They are quite simply amazing , each and everyone from the cleaning and  
catering staff , the nurses to all of the consultants .  
All to often we hear negative press about the hospital - we were blessed with overwhelming care, support , love and laughs and the best of treatment anyone could have asked for.  
Today my partner got his Stem Cell Transplant - that would not have been possible without the entire team of Ward 4C - Haematolgy  
You are THE best and will be forever in our hearts .  
Thank you

readBy.name: Office of Ken Macintosh, MSP for West of Scotland

title: A nurse of quality
body:
The service, compassion and consideration I have received from this individual outshines all bar one in the fifty two years I have been registered with this surgery.

She is friendly, explains what you as a patient need to know in full and clearly, using layman terms so as not to confuse you at critical times.
